fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: All relevant EU initiatives in the areas of research, innovation and education, which include (but are not limited to): FP7, Horizon 2020, Marie Curie and ERC; EU Higher Education Policy; European Research Area; EU Research Policy; better regulation; European Cloud Initiative; Innovation Union; Digital Single Market Strategy, etc.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
- Vereniging Samenwerkende Nederlandse Universiteiten: http://www.vsnu.nl/nl_NL/index.html  
- International Association of Universities: http://www.iau-aiu.net/content/international-conferences
relevant_communication: The Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam on a regular basis organises seminars that broaden and expand on the knowledge on European policy within the organisation. Also, researchers of the VU University Medical Centre regularly (co-)organise conferences on European financed research programmes and research projects.
